Religious sacrificial ceremonies

Since ancient times, what emperor or king who received the mandate has not performed feng and shan? There have been those who performed the rituals without the proper omens, but there have never been those who saw auspicious signs appear yet did not proceed to Mount Tai. Even though they received the mandate, if their merit was not sufficient, or having arrived at Liang Fu their virtue was not pervasive, or it was pervasive but their days were insufficient, therefore they rarely performed the rituals. The tradition says: 'If for three years one does not perform the rites, the rites will certainly be abandoned;' If for three years one does not make music, the music will certainly decay.' In every flourishing age, feng and shan are performed in response; when it declines, they cease. The distant ones are more than a thousand years ago, the recent ones several hundred years ago, therefore their rituals are completely lost and extinguished, and the details cannot be recorded or heard.

The Shang Shu says: Shun was at the Xuan Ji and Yu Heng to align the seven governances. Then he offered sacrifice to the Supreme God, made offerings to the Six Honored Ones, gazed at mountains and rivers, and universally honored the various spirits. He gathered the five tokens of virtue, chose auspicious months and days, met with the lords of the four peaks and the various shepherds, and returned the tokens. In the second month of the year, he toured the east, arriving at Dai Zong. Dai Zong is Mount Tai. He made burnt offerings, gazing and arranging the mountains and rivers. Then he had an audience with the Eastern Lords. The Eastern Lords are the feudal lords. He unified the seasons, months, and first days; standardized pitch pipes, measures, and weights; repaired the five rites; five jades, three silks, two living and one dead offerings. In the fifth month, he toured and arrived at the Southern Peak. The Southern Peak is Mount Heng. In the eighth month, he toured and arrived at the Western Peak. The Western Peak is Mount Hua. In the eleventh month, he toured and arrived at the Northern Peak. The Northern Peak is Mount Heng. All were like the rites at Dai Zong. The Central Peak is Song Gao. Every five years one imperial tour.
3
ç¦¹éµä¹‹ã€‚ å¾Œåå››ä¸–ï¼Œè‡³å¸å­”ç”²ï¼Œæ·«å¾·å¥½ç¥ï¼Œç¥ç€†ï¼ŒäºŒé¾å»ä¹‹ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œä¸‰ä¸–ï¼Œæ¹¯ä¼æ¡€ï¼Œæ¬²é·å¤ç¤¾ï¼Œä¸å¯ï¼Œä½œå¤ç¤¾ã€‚ å¾Œå…«ä¸–ï¼Œè‡³å¸å¤ªæˆŠï¼Œæœ‰æ¡‘è°·ç”Ÿæ–¼å»·ï¼Œä¸€æš®å¤§æ‹±ï¼Œæ‡¼ã€‚ ä¼Šé™Ÿæ›°ï¼šã€Œå¦–ä¸å‹å¾·ã€‚ã€ å¤ªæˆŠä¿®å¾·ï¼Œæ¡‘è°·æ­»ã€‚ ä¼Šé™Ÿè´Šå·«å’¸ï¼Œå·«å’¸ä¹‹èˆˆè‡ªæ­¤å§‹ã€‚ å¾Œåå››ä¸–ï¼Œå¸æ­¦ä¸å¾—å‚…èªªç‚ºç›¸ï¼Œæ®·å¾©èˆˆç„‰ï¼Œç¨±é«˜å®—ã€‚ æœ‰é›‰ç™»é¼è€³é›Šï¼Œæ­¦ä¸æ‡¼ã€‚ ç¥–å·±æ›°ï¼šã€Œä¿®å¾·ã€‚ã€ æ­¦ä¸å¾ä¹‹ï¼Œä½ä»¥æ°¸å¯§ã€‚ å¾Œäº”ä¸–ï¼Œå¸æ­¦ä¹™æ…¢ç¥è€Œéœ‡æ­»ã€‚ å¾Œä¸‰ä¸–ï¼Œå¸ç´‚æ·«äº‚ï¼Œæ­¦ç‹ä¼ä¹‹ã€‚ ç”±æ­¤è§€ä¹‹ï¼Œå§‹æœªå˜—ä¸è‚…ç¥—ï¼Œå¾Œç¨æ€ æ…¢ä¹Ÿã€‚
Yu followed this. Fourteen generations later, to Emperor Kong Jia, whose virtue was licentious and who favored spirits; the spirits were defiled, and two dragons left him. After three more generations, Tang attacked Jie; he wished to move the Xia altar but could not, so he made a Xia altar. Eight generations later, to Emperor Tai Wu, there was a mulberry tree that grew in the courtyard; in one evening it became large enough to embrace, and he was afraid. Yi Zhi said: 'Monsters cannot overcome virtue.' Tai Wu cultivated virtue, and the mulberry millet died. Yi Zhi assisted Wu Xian, and Wu Xian's rise began from this. Fourteen generations later, Emperor Wu Ding obtained Fu Yue as chancellor, Yin revived, and he was called Gao Zong. A pheasant climbed onto the cauldron's ear and crowed; Wu Ding was afraid. Zu Ji said: 'Cultivate virtue.' Wu Ding followed this advice, and his position achieved eternal peace. Five generations later, Emperor Wu Yi was disrespectful to the spirits and died struck by lightning. Three generations later, Emperor Zhou was licentious and disorderly, so King Wu attacked him. From this we can see that at first they were never not reverent and respectful, but later they gradually became negligent.
4
å‘¨å®˜æ›°ï¼Œå†¬æ—¥è‡³ï¼Œç¥€å¤©æ–¼å—éƒŠï¼Œè¿é•·æ—¥ä¹‹è‡³ï¼› å¤æ—¥è‡³ï¼Œç¥­åœ°ç¥—ã€‚ çš†ç”¨æ¨‚èˆï¼Œè€Œç¥ä¹ƒå¯å¾—è€Œç¦®ä¹Ÿã€‚ å¤©å­ç¥­å¤©ä¸‹åå±±å¤§å·ï¼Œäº”å¶½è¦–ä¸‰å…¬ï¼Œå››ç€†è¦–è«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯ç¥­å…¶ç–†å…§åå±±å¤§å·ã€‚ å››ç€†è€…ï¼Œæ±Ÿã€æ²³ã€æ·®ã€æ¿Ÿä¹Ÿã€‚ å¤©å­æ›°æ˜å ‚ã€è¾Ÿé›ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯æ›°æ³®å®®ã€‚
The Zhou officials say: when the winter solstice arrives, sacrifice to heaven at the southern suburb, welcoming the arrival of longer days; When the summer solstice arrives, sacrifice to the earth spirits. All use music and dance, and then the spirits can be obtained and honored. The emperor sacrifices to all the famous mountains and great rivers under heaven; the five peaks are treated like the three dukes, the four rivers like the feudal lords; the feudal lords sacrifice to the famous mountains and great rivers within their territories. The four rivers are the Jiang, He, Huai, and Ji. The emperor calls them the Bright Hall and Pi Yong; the feudal lords call them the Pan Palace.

å‘¨å…¬æ—¢ç›¸æˆç‹ï¼ŒéƒŠç¥€åç¨·ä»¥é…å¤©ï¼Œå®—ç¥€æ–‡ç‹æ–¼æ˜å ‚ä»¥é…ä¸Šå¸ã€‚ è‡ªç¦¹èˆˆè€Œä¿®ç¤¾ç¥€ï¼Œåç¨·ç¨¼ç©¡ï¼Œæ•…æœ‰ç¨·ç¥ ï¼ŒéƒŠç¤¾æ‰€å¾ä¾†å°šçŸ£ã€‚
The Duke of Zhou, having become chancellor to King Cheng, performed suburban sacrifices to Hou Ji to match heaven, and ancestral sacrifices to King Wen in the Bright Hall to match the Supreme God. Since Yu rose and repaired the altar sacrifices, Hou Ji plowed and harvested, therefore there are Ji sacrifices; the suburban and altar sacrifices have come from ancient times.

è‡ªå‘¨å…‹æ®·å¾Œåå››ä¸–ï¼Œä¸–ç›Šè¡°ï¼Œç¦®æ¨‚å»¢ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯æ£è¡Œï¼Œè€Œå¹½ç‹ç‚ºçŠ¬æˆæ‰€æ•—ï¼Œå‘¨æ±å¾™é›’é‚‘ã€‚ ç§¦è¥„å…¬æ”»æˆæ•‘å‘¨ï¼Œå§‹åˆ—ç‚ºè«¸ä¾¯ã€‚ ç§¦è¥„å…¬æ—¢ä¾¯ï¼Œå±…è¥¿å‚ï¼Œè‡ªä»¥ç‚ºä¸»å°‘çšä¹‹ç¥ï¼Œä½œè¥¿ç•¤ï¼Œç¥ ç™½å¸ï¼Œå…¶ç‰²ç”¨é¨®é§’é»ƒç‰›ç¾ç¾Šå„ä¸€äº‘ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œåå…­å¹´ï¼Œç§¦æ–‡å…¬æ±çµæ±§æ¸­ä¹‹é–’ï¼Œåœå±…ä¹‹è€Œå‰ã€‚ æ–‡å…¬å¤¢é»ƒè›‡è‡ªå¤©ä¸‹å±¬åœ°ï¼Œå…¶å£æ­¢æ–¼é„œè¡ã€‚ æ–‡å…¬å•å²æ•¦ï¼Œæ•¦æ›°ï¼šã€Œæ­¤ä¸Šå¸ä¹‹å¾µï¼Œå›å…¶ç¥ ä¹‹ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ä½œé„œç•¤ï¼Œç”¨ä¸‰ç‰²éƒŠç¥­ç™½å¸ç„‰ã€‚
Since Zhou conquered Yin, after fourteen generations, the generations increasingly declined, rites and music were abandoned, the feudal lords acted wantonly, and King You was defeated by the Quanrong, Zhou moved east to Luo yi. Qin Xiang Gong attacked the Rong to save Zhou, and began being ranked among the feudal lords. Qin Xiang Gong, having become a marquis, dwelt in the western border, considering himself master of Shao Hao's god, made the Western Altar, sacrificed to the White Emperor, using sorrel colts, yellow oxen, and rams as victims, each one, they say. Sixteen years later, Qin Wen Gong hunted east between the Qian and Wei, divined dwelling there and it was auspicious. Wen Gong dreamed of a yellow snake descending from heaven to earth, its mouth stopping at Fu Yan. Wen Gong asked Shi Dun, who said: 'This is a sign from the Supreme God; my lord should sacrifice to it.' Therefore he made the Fu Altar, using three victims to perform suburban sacrifice to the White Emperor.

è‡ªæœªä½œé„œç•¤ä¹Ÿï¼Œè€Œé›æ—æ•…æœ‰å³é™½æ­¦ç•¤ï¼Œé›æ±æœ‰å¥½ç•¤ï¼Œçš†å»¢ç„¡ç¥ ã€‚ æˆ–æ›°ï¼šã€Œè‡ªå¤ä»¥é›å·ç©é«˜ï¼Œç¥æ˜ä¹‹éš©ï¼Œæ•…ç«‹ç•¤éƒŠä¸Šå¸ï¼Œè«¸ç¥ç¥ çš†èšäº‘ã€‚ è“‹é»ƒå¸æ™‚å˜—ç”¨äº‹ï¼Œé›–æ™šå‘¨äº¦éƒŠç„‰ã€‚ã€ å…¶èªä¸ç¶“è¦‹ï¼Œç¸‰ç´³è€…ä¸é“ã€‚
Since the Fu Altar was not yet made, beside Yong there originally were the Wu Yang Wu Altar and east of Yong the Hao Altar, all abandoned without sacrifice. Some say: 'Since ancient times Yong province has been piled high, a recess for the spirits and bright ones, therefore altars were established and suburban sacrifices made to the Supreme God, with sacrifices to all the various spirits gathering there.' Probably in the Yellow Emperor's time this was once performed; even in the late Zhou they also performed suburban sacrifices there.' These words are not commonly seen; noble scholars do not speak of them.

ä½œé„œç•¤å¾Œä¹å¹´ï¼Œæ–‡å…¬ç²è‹¥çŸ³é›²ï¼Œäºé™³å€‰åŒ—é˜ªåŸç¥ ä¹‹ã€‚ å…¶ç¥æˆ–æ­²ä¸è‡³ï¼Œæˆ–æ­²æ•¸ä¾†ï¼Œä¾†ä¹Ÿå¸¸ä»¥å¤œï¼Œå…‰è¼è‹¥æµæ˜Ÿï¼Œå¾æ±å—ä¾†é›†äºç¥ åŸï¼Œå‰‡è‹¥é›„é›ï¼Œå…¶è²æ®·é›²ï¼Œé‡é›å¤œé›Šã€‚ ä»¥ä¸€ç‰¢ç¥ ï¼Œå‘½æ›°é™³å¯¶ã€‚
Nine years after making the Fu Altar, Wen Gong obtained something like a stone cloud, and at Chen Cang's northern slope he built a city to sacrifice to it. Its spirit sometimes did not arrive for a year, sometimes came several times a year; when it came it was always at night, with radiance like a shooting star, coming from the southeast to gather at the sacrifice city, sounding like a male chicken, its voice deep like thunder, with wild chickens crowing at night. Used one set of livestock to sacrifice, named it Chen Bao.
9
ä½œé„œç•¤å¾Œä¸ƒåå…«å¹´ï¼Œç§¦å¾·å…¬æ—¢ç«‹ï¼Œåœå±…é›ï¼Œã€Œå¾Œå­å­«é£²é¦¬æ–¼æ²³ã€ï¼Œé‚éƒ½é›ã€‚ é›ä¹‹è«¸ç¥ è‡ªæ­¤èˆˆã€‚ ç”¨ä¸‰ç™¾ç‰¢æ–¼é„œç•¤ã€‚ ä½œä¼ç¥ ã€‚ ç£”ç‹—é‚‘å››é–€ï¼Œä»¥å¾¡è ±è‘ã€‚
Seventy-eight years after making the Fu Altar, Qin De Gong, having been established, divined dwelling in Yong, 'Later descendants will drink horses at the river,' and so made Yong the capital. Yong's various sacrifices began from this. Used three hundred sets of livestock at the Fu Altar. Made the Fu sacrifice. Split dogs at the four gates of the city, to ward off gu disasters.

å¾·å…¬ç«‹äºŒå¹´å’ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œï¼ˆå…­ï¼‰ï¼»å››ï¼½å¹´ï¼Œç§¦å®£å…¬ä½œå¯†ç•¤æ–¼æ¸­å—ï¼Œç¥­é’å¸ã€‚
De Gong was established for two years and then died. Four years later, Qin Xuan Gong made the Mi Altar south of the Wei, sacrificing to the Qing Emperor.

å…¶å¾Œåå››å¹´ï¼Œç§¦ç¹†å…¬ç«‹ï¼Œç—…è‡¥äº”æ—¥ä¸å¯¤ï¼› å¯¤ï¼Œä¹ƒè¨€å¤¢è¦‹ä¸Šå¸ï¼Œä¸Šå¸å‘½ç¹†å…¬å¹³æ™‰äº‚ã€‚ å²æ›¸è€Œè¨˜è—ä¹‹åºœã€‚ è€Œå¾Œä¸–çš†æ›°ç§¦ç¹†å…¬ä¸Šå¤©ã€‚
Fourteen years later, Qin Mu Gong was established; he fell ill and lay unconscious for five days; When he awoke, he said he dreamed of seeing the Supreme God, who commanded Mu Gong to pacify the Jin disorder. The scribe wrote it down and recorded it, storing it in the treasury. And later generations all said that Qin Mu Gong ascended to heaven.

ç§¦ç¹†å…¬å³ä½ä¹å¹´ï¼Œé½Šæ¡“å…¬æ—¢éœ¸ï¼Œæœƒè«¸ä¾¯æ–¼è‘µä¸˜ï¼Œè€Œæ¬²å°ç¦ªã€‚ ç®¡ä»²æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤è€…å°æ³°å±±ç¦ªæ¢çˆ¶è€…ä¸ƒåäºŒå®¶ï¼Œè€Œå¤·å¾æ‰€è¨˜è€…åæœ‰äºŒç„‰ã€‚ æ˜”ç„¡æ‡·æ°å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› è™™ç¾²å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› ç¥è¾²å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› ç‚å¸å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› é»ƒå¸å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº­äº­ï¼› é¡“é Šå°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› å¸åš³å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› å ¯å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› èˆœå°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› ç¦¹å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªæœƒç¨½ï¼› æ¹¯å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªäº‘äº‘ï¼› å‘¨æˆç‹å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªç¤¾é¦–ï¼šçš†å—å‘½ç„¶å¾Œå¾—å°ç¦ªã€‚ã€ æ¡“å…¬æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¯¡äººåŒ—ä¼å±±æˆï¼Œéå­¤ç«¹ï¼› è¥¿ä¼å¤§å¤ï¼Œæ¶‰æµæ²™ï¼ŒæŸé¦¬æ‡¸è»Šï¼Œä¸Šå‘è€³ä¹‹å±±ï¼› å—ä¼è‡³å¬é™µï¼Œç™»ç†Šè€³å±±ä»¥æœ›æ±Ÿæ¼¢ã€‚ å…µè»Šä¹‹æœƒä¸‰ï¼Œè€Œä¹˜è»Šä¹‹æœƒå…­ï¼Œä¹åˆè«¸ä¾¯ï¼Œä¸€åŒ¡å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œè«¸ä¾¯è«é•æˆ‘ã€‚ æ˜”ä¸‰ä»£å—å‘½ï¼Œäº¦ä½•ä»¥ç•°ä¹ï¼Ÿã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ç®¡ä»²ç¹æ¡“å…¬ä¸å¯çª®ä»¥è¾­ï¼Œå› è¨­ä¹‹ä»¥äº‹ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤ä¹‹å°ç¦ªï¼Œé„—ä¸Šä¹‹é»ï¼ŒåŒ—é‡Œä¹‹ç¦¾ï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç‚ºç››ï¼› æ±Ÿæ·®ä¹‹é–’ï¼Œä¸€èŒ…ä¸‰è„Šï¼Œæ‰€ä»¥ç‚ºè—‰ä¹Ÿã€‚ æ±æµ·è‡´æ¯”ç›®ä¹‹é­šï¼Œè¥¿æµ·è‡´æ¯”ç¿¼ä¹‹é³¥ï¼Œç„¶å¾Œç‰©æœ‰ä¸å¬è€Œè‡ªè‡³è€…åæœ‰äº”ç„‰ã€‚ ä»Šé³³çš‡éº’éºŸä¸ä¾†ï¼Œå˜‰ç©€ä¸ç”Ÿï¼Œè€Œè“¬è’¿è—œè èŒ‚ï¼Œé´Ÿæ¢Ÿæ•¸è‡³ï¼Œè€Œæ¬²å°ç¦ªï¼Œæ¯‹ä¹ƒä¸å¯ä¹ï¼Ÿã€ æ–¼æ˜¯æ¡“å…¬ä¹ƒæ­¢ã€‚ æ˜¯æ­²ï¼Œç§¦ç¹†å…¬å…§æ™‰å›å¤·å¾ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œä¸‰ç½®æ™‰åœ‹ä¹‹å›ï¼Œå¹³å…¶äº‚ã€‚ ç¹†å…¬ç«‹ä¸‰åä¹å¹´è€Œå’ã€‚
Qin Mu Gong had been on the throne for nine years; Qi Huan Gong had already achieved hegemony and assembled the feudal lords at Kui Qiu, wishing to perform feng and shan. Guan Zhong said: 'Of the ancient ones who performed feng on Tai Shan and shan on Liang Fu, there were seventy-two families, and of those that Yi Wu recorded, there are twelve.' In the past, the Wu Huai clan performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; Fu Xi performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; Shen Nong performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; The Yan Emperor performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; The Yellow Emperor performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Ting Ting; Zhuan Xu performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; Emperor Ku performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; Yao performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; Shun performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; Yu performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Kui Ji; Tang performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on Yun Yun; Zhou Cheng Wang performed feng on Tai Shan, shan on She Shou: all received the mandate before being able to perform feng and shan.' Huan Gong said: 'I attacked the Shan Rong to the north, passed Gu Zhu; Attacked Da Xia to the west, forded the flowing sands, bound horses and hung chariots, ascended Bei Er Mountain; Attacked south to Zhao Ling, ascended Xiong Er Mountain to gaze at the Jiang and Han. I assembled with war chariots three times, and with ceremonial chariots six times; nine times I assembled the feudal lords, once rectified the world; the feudal lords none violated me. In the past, the Three Dynasties received the mandate, how were they different?' Therefore Guan Zhong saw that Duke Huan could not be convinced with words alone, so he used facts to persuade him, saying: 'In ancient feng and shan, the millet from Xiang Shang, the grain from Bei Li, were used for the offerings; Between the Jiang and Huai, one thatch with three ridges was used as the mat. The Eastern Sea brought paired fish, the Western Sea brought paired birds, then there were things that came without being summoned, fifteen of them. Now phoenixes and unicorns do not come, auspicious grains do not grow, but thistles and weeds flourish, owls come frequently; wanting to perform feng and shan, is it not perhaps impossible?' Therefore Duke Huan stopped. That year, Qin Mu Gong brought in Duke Yi Wu of Jin. Thereafter he established three lords of Jin state, pacifying their disorder. Mu Gong was established for thirty-nine years and then died.

Qin Shi Huang, having united the world and become emperor, some said: 'The Yellow Emperor obtained earth virtue; yellow dragons and earthworms appeared.' Having ascended the emperor position for three years, he toured east to the commanderies and counties, sacrificed at Zou Yi Mountain, and praised Qin's meritorious deeds. Therefore he summoned and had follow seventy Confucian scholars and erudites from Qi and Lu, arriving at the base of Tai Shan. Various Confucian scholars some discussed, saying: 'In ancient times for feng and shan they made cattail carts, hating to harm the mountain's soil, stones, grasses, and trees;' They swept the ground and sacrificed, mats used pickled straw, saying it was easy to follow.' Shi Huang heard that these discussions were each divergent, difficult to apply and use, and from this demoted the Confucian scholars. And then he cleared a cart road, ascended from the sunny side of Tai Shan to the peak, erected a stone praising Qin Shi Huang's virtue, making clear that he obtained the feng. He descended by the shady path, performing shan at Liang Fu. Its rites considerably adopted what the Grand Officiant used in sacrificing to the Supreme God at Yong, and the feng burials were all kept secret, so generations could not record them.

Therefore Shi Huang then toured east to the sea, performing rites and sacrificing to famous mountains, great rivers, and the eight gods, seeking immortals like Xianmen and others. The eight gods have existed since ancient times, or some say they were created from the time of Tai Gong. Qi is called Qi because of Tian Qi. Its sacrifices have been discontinued; no one knows when they began. The eight gods: first is the Heavenly Lord, sacrificed to at Tian Qi. Tian Qi is a deep pool of water, located below the mountain in the southern suburbs of Linzi. Second is the Earth Lord, sacrificed to at Tai Shan and Liang Fu. For heaven prefers yin, sacrificing to it must be below high mountains, above small mountains, named 'zhi'; For earth values yang, sacrificing to it must be in the middle of marshes at round mounds, they say. Third is the War Lord, sacrificed to Chi You. Chi You is in Dongping Lu Jian township, which is Qi's western border. Fourth is the Yin Lord, sacrificed to at the Three Mountains. Fifth is the Yang Lord, sacrificed to at Chi Fu. Sixth is the Moon Lord, sacrificed to at Lai Shan. All are in Qi's north, bordering the Bo Sea. Seventh is the Sun Lord, sacrificed to at Cheng Shan. Cheng Shan juts into the sea, located at the northeasternmost corner of Qi, to welcome the sunrise, they say. Eighth is the Four Seasons Lord, sacrificed to at Langya. Langya is in Qi's east, probably where the year begins. All each used one sacrificial animal for sacrifice, and the shamans' additions and subtractions, jade and silks were mixed and different there.

In the past the three dynasties' residences were all between the Yellow River and Luo, therefore Songgao was the central peak, and the four peaks each in their proper directions, the four estuaries all in Shandong. In the second year, he attacked Xiang Ji in the east and returned entering the pass, asking: 'In former Qin times, what emperors did the Supreme God sacrifices sacrifice to?' That year he formulated: 'I have ascended the position thirteen years to now, relied on the ancestral temple's spirit, she and ji's blessing, within the borders peaceful, the people without illness.' The Lu person Gongsun Chen submitted a memorial saying: 'Originally Qin obtained water virtue, now Han receives it; pushing the beginning and end succession, then Han should have earth virtue, earth virtue's response is the yellow dragon appearing.' At this time Chancellor Zhang Cang liked laws and calendars, thought that Han was the beginning of water virtue, therefore the Yellow River bursting the Jin dike was its omen. The year begins in the tenth month of winter, color outside black inside red, corresponding with the virtue. As Gongsun Chen said, it is not so. Dismissed it. Three years later, a yellow dragon appeared at Chengji. Wen emperor then summoned Gongsun Chen, appointed him as an erudite, and with the various scholars drafted matters of changing the calendar and clothing colors. That summer he issued an edict saying: 'A strange god appeared at Chengji, causing no harm to the people, and the year had an abundant harvest.' I pray to the suburban Supreme God and various gods; let the rites officials discuss, do not taboo tiring me.' The officials all said: 'In ancient times the Son of Heaven in summer personally performed the suburban sacrifice, sacrificing to the Supreme God at the suburban altar, therefore it is called suburban.' Therefore in the fourth month of summer, Wen emperor began the suburban audience of the Yong five zhi sacrifice, all clothing honoring red.

The next year, the Qi person Shao Weng with ghosts and gods methods appeared before the emperor. The emperor had favored Lady Wang; the lady died; Shao Weng with methods probably brought Lady Wang and the stove ghost appearances at night, they say; the Son of Heaven from the curtain middle looked and saw them. Therefore then appointed Shao Weng as General Wencheng, rewards very many, treated him with guest rites. Wencheng said: 'If the emperor wants to communicate with gods, the palaces and clothing do not resemble gods; god things will not come.' Then made painted cloud qi chariots, and each drove chariots on victorious days to ward off evil ghosts. Again made Ganquan Palace, middle for tower rooms, painted heaven, earth, Tai Yi and various ghosts and gods, and placed sacrifice utensils to attract heaven gods. Dwelt over a year, his methods increasingly declined, gods did not come. Then made a silk book and fed it to the ox, pretended not to know, said this ox's belly has a strange thing. Killed and inspected, got the book; the book spoke very strangely. The Son of Heaven recognized his handwriting, asked that person; indeed it was a false book, therefore executed General Wencheng, concealed it.

The next year after Wencheng died, the Son of Heaven was very ill at Ding Hu, employed shamans and doctors of every kind, but was not cured. You Shui Fagen said Shang commandery had a shaman who, when ill, had ghosts and gods descend to him. The emperor summoned and placed sacrifice to him at Ganquan. When ill, sent people to ask the god lord. The god lord said: 'Son of Heaven do not worry about illness.' Illness slightly better, strongly meet with me at Ganquan.' Therefore the illness was cured, then he rose, visited Ganquan, the illness truly gone. Great amnesty, established the longevity palace god lord. The longevity palace god lord's most honored is Tai Yi, its assistants called great prohibition, destiny master and such, all followed him. Could not be seen; heard his words, which were equal to human voice. Sometimes went sometimes came; when came then the wind was solemn. Dwelt in the room's curtain middle. Sometimes spoke in daytime, but constantly at night. The Son of Heaven purified himself, then entered. Because the shaman was host, controlled the eating and drinking. What was spoken went down. Again established the longevity palace and north palace, spread feather flags, set up offering utensils, to ritually treat the god lord. What the god lord spoke, the emperor had people receive and write his words, named it 'painting method'. What he spoke was what worldly customs knew, with no extremely different things, but the Son of Heaven's heart alone was happy. Its matters were secret; the world no one knew.

The next year in winter, the Son of Heaven suburban Yong, discussed and said: 'Now the Supreme God I personally suburban sacrifice to, but Hou Tu has no sacrifice, then the rites are not reciprocal.' That spring, Marquis Lecheng submitted a memorial speaking of Luan Da. Luan Da was a Jiaodong palace person who formerly once studied with General Wencheng as the same teacher, then became King Jiaodong's director of medicine. And Marquis Lecheng's sister was King Kang's queen, with no children. King Kang died, another concubine's son was established as king. And Queen Kang had licentious behavior, was not compatible with the king, mutually threatened each other with law. Queen Kang heard Wencheng was already dead, and wished to flatter the emperor herself, then sent Luan Da through Marquis Lecheng to seek an audience and speak of methods. The Son of Heaven having already executed Wencheng, later regretted his early death, pitied that his methods were not complete, and when he saw Luan Da, was greatly pleased. Da was a person tall and beautiful, speech full of strategies, and dared to make big words and handle matters without doubt. Da said: 'Minister constantly came and went in the sea, saw An Qi, Xianmen and such.' Only because minister is base, do not believe minister. Also thought King Kang was only a feudal lord, not worth sharing methods with. Minister several times spoke to King Kang, King Kang again did not use minister. Minister's teacher said: 'Gold can be made, and the Yellow River breach can be blocked, immortality medicine can be obtained, immortals can be brought.' But minister feared following Wencheng, then all fangshi would shut their mouths; how would they dare speak of methods!' The emperor said: 'Wencheng only died from eating horse liver.' If you truly can practice his methods, what would I begrudge!' Da said: 'Minister's teacher does not seek people; people seek him.' Your Majesty must want to obtain them, then honor their envoys, make them have relatives, treat them with guest rites, do not belittle them, make each wear their trust seals, then can make them communicate words to the god people. Will the god people still be willing or not? Honor their envoys greatly, then they can be obtained.' Therefore the emperor made him test small methods; fighting chess where the pieces struck each other themselves.

At this time the emperor was just worried about the Yellow River breach, and the gold was not completed, so he appointed Da as Five Benefits general. I have ruled the world twenty-eight years; heaven if sent me a scholar and greatly passed. Qian says 'flying dragon', 'hong gradually to ban'; my intent perhaps is with that. Should with two thousand households seal Earth Soldier general Da as Le Tong hou.' Granted the marquises first mansions, thousand youths. Envoys visited and supplied, connected on the road. From the great chief, generals, and ministers below, all placed wine in his house, offered gifts to him. Therefore the Son of Heaven again carved a jade seal saying 'Heaven Dao general', sent the envoy wearing feather clothes, night stood on white thatch above, the Five Benefits general also wore feather clothes, night stood on white thatch above to receive the seal, to show not subject. Da appeared for several months, wore six seals, his nobility shook the world, and between the sea Yan and Qi, none did not grip and self-claim they had forbidden methods, could god immortal.

That summer in the middle of the sixth month, Fen Yin shaman Jin sacrificed to Wei Wei Hou Tu beside the camp for the people, saw the ground like a hook shape, dug and looked, got a ding. The ding was greatly different from ordinary dings, its engraved patterns had no inscriptions; they considered it strange and told the official. The official told Hedong governor Sheng, and Sheng reported it. The Son of Heaven sent an envoy to verify and question the shaman who obtained the ding, there was no deceit or fraud, then sacrificed with rites, welcomed the ding to Gan Quan, followed the journey, the emperor offered it. Arrived at Zhongshan, warm mist, there was a yellow cloud covering it. A deer passed by, the emperor personally shot it, thus used it to sacrifice, they say. Arrived at Chang'an, all the dukes, ministers, and officials discussed and requested to honor the treasure ding. The Son of Heaven said: 'Recently the Yellow River overflowed, several years had poor harvests, therefore I toured and sacrificed to Hou Tu, prayed for the common people to nurture grains.' The abundant year has not yet been reported; why has the ding come out?' All the officials said: 'We heard that formerly the Tai Emperor raised a divine ding, one means unity, the end to which heaven, earth, and the ten thousand things are attached.' The Yellow Emperor made three treasure dings, symbolizing heaven, earth, and man. Yu collected the gold from the nine provinces and cast nine dings. All once cooked and offered to Shang Di and the ghosts and gods. When meeting a sage they rose; the dings moved to Xia and Shang. Zhou virtue declined, Song's altar perished, the dings then sank and submerged, hid and were not seen. The ode says 'from hall to foundation, from sheep to ox;' Nai ding and nao, not Wu not Ao, Hu long its good.' Now the ding has arrived at Gan Quan, its light moist and dragon-transformed, receiving goodness without limit. Meeting this Zhongshan, yellow and white clouds descended and covered it, like beasts as signs, road bows and riding arrows gathered and obtained below the altar, report sacrifice great feast. Only those who receive the mandate and become emperor know its meaning in their hearts and unite virtue there. The ding should appear before the ancestors, be hidden in the emperor's court, to unite bright responses.' The edict said: 'Acceptable.'

That autumn, the emperor went to Yong, about to perform the suburban sacrifice. Someone said: 'The Five Emperors are Tai Yi's assistants; it is fitting to establish Tai Yi and have the emperor personally perform the suburban sacrifice to it.' The emperor was doubtful and undecided. The Qi person Gongsun Qing said: 'This year we obtained the treasure ding; its winter Xin Si first day and winter solstice are equal to the Yellow Emperor's time.' Qing had a bamboo book that said: 'The Yellow Emperor obtained the treasure ding at Wan Qu and asked Gui You Qu about it.' Gui You Qu replied: '[The Yellow] Emperor obtained the treasure ding and divine plan; this year Ji You first day and winter solstice obtained heaven's order, end and begin again.' Therefore the Yellow Emperor welcomed the sun and pushed the plan; afterward every twenty years again the first day and winter solstice, altogether twenty pushes, three hundred eighty years, the Yellow Emperor immortal ascended to heaven.' Qing wished to memorial it through Suo Zhong. Suo Zhong viewed the book as irregular and doubted it was false writing; he declined saying: 'The treasure ding matter is already decided; what more is there to do!' Qing memorialed it through a favorite person. The emperor was greatly pleased, then summoned and questioned Qing. He replied: 'I received this book from Shen Gong; Shen Gong is already dead.' The emperor said: 'Who is Shen Gong?' Qing said: 'Shen Gong is a Qi person.' He communicated with An Qisheng and received the Yellow Emperor's words; there was no book, only this ding book. He said 'The Han rise should again be like the Yellow Emperor's time.' He said 'The Han sage will be Gao Zu's grandson and great-grandson.' The treasure ding comes out and communicates with the gods, performing feng and shan. Feng and shan by seventy-two kings; only the Yellow Emperor got to ascend Tai Shan for feng.' Shen Gong said: 'The Han ruler should also ascend for feng; ascending for feng can make one immortal and ascend to heaven.' In the Yellow Emperor's time there were ten thousand feudal lords, and the god spirits' feng numbered seven thousand. The world's famous mountains number eight; three are in the barbarian Yi, five in the central states. The central states' Hua Shan, Shou Shan, Tai Shi, Tai Shan, Dong Laiâ€”these five mountains were where the Yellow Emperor often wandered and met with the gods. The Yellow Emperor both fought and learned immortality. He worried that the common people were not following his way, so he severed and executed those who were not ghosts or gods. After a hundred or more years he then got to communicate with the gods. The Yellow Emperor performed suburban sacrifices to Shang Di at Yong, staying three months. Gui You Qu was styled Da Hong; he died and was buried at Yong, therefore the Hong Tomb is this. Afterward the Yellow Emperor received the ten thousand spirits at the bright court. The bright court is Gan Quan. The so-called cold gate is Gu Kou. The Yellow Emperor gathered copper from Shou Shan and cast the ding below Jing Shan. The ding having been completed, there was a dragon hanging its beard whiskers below to welcome the Yellow Emperor. The Yellow Emperor ascended and rode; the group ministers and harem who followed and ascended numbered seventy or more people; the dragon then ascended and went. The remaining small ministers did not get to ascend, so they all held the dragon's whiskers; the dragon's whiskers were pulled, they fell, falling with the Yellow Emperor's bow. The common people looked up as the Yellow Emperor had already ascended to heaven, then embraced his bow and whiskers and wailed; therefore later generations named that place Ding Lake, and his bow Wu Hao.' Therefore the Son of Heaven said: 'Alas!' If I truly get to be like the Yellow Emperor, I view leaving my wife and children like removing shoes only.' Then he appointed Qing as a lang and sent him east to await the gods at Tai Shi.

The emperor then performed suburban sacrifices at Yong, arrived at Long Xi, west ascended Kong Tong, visited Gan Quan. That spring, having extinguished Nan Yue, the emperor had his favorite minister Li Yan Nian appear with good music. The emperor considered it good and sent it down for the dukes and ministers to discuss, saying: 'Common people's sacrifices still have drum and dance music; now suburban sacrifices but no music, how is this fitting?' The dukes and ministers said: 'Ancient ones who sacrificed to heaven and earth all had music, and the gods could be obtained and ritualed.' Someone said: 'The Great Emperor made Su Nu drum a fifty-string zither; it was sad; the emperor forbade it but it did not stop, therefore he broke its zither into twenty-five strings.' Therefore having blocked Nan Yue, they prayed and sacrificed to Tai Yi and Hou Tu, began using music and dance, moreover summoned singing boys, made twenty-five strings and kong hou, qin, se; from this they arose.

Its next year winter, the emperor discussed and said: 'Ancient ones first shook the troops and moistened the army, then performed feng and shan.' Then he therefore toured north to Shuofang, restrained over a hundred thousand troops, returned and sacrificed at the Yellow Emperor's tomb at Qiao Shan, released the troops and waited like that. The emperor said: 'I heard the Yellow Emperor does not die; now he has a tomb, what is this?' Someone replied: 'The Yellow Emperor has already become immortal and ascended to heaven; the group ministers buried his clothes and cap.' Having arrived at Gan Quan, for about to perform affairs at Tai Shan, first similarly sacrificed to Tai Yi.

è‡ªå¾—å¯¶é¼ï¼Œä¸Šèˆ‡å…¬å¿è«¸ç”Ÿè­°å°ç¦ªã€‚ å°ç¦ªç”¨å¸Œæ› çµ•ï¼Œè«çŸ¥å…¶å„€ç¦®ï¼Œè€Œç¾¤å„’é‡‡å°ç¦ªå°šæ›¸ã€å‘¨å®˜ã€ç‹åˆ¶ä¹‹æœ›ç¥€å°„ç‰›äº‹ã€‚ é½Šäººä¸å…¬å¹´ä¹åé¤˜ï¼Œæ›°ï¼šã€Œå°ç¦ªè€…ï¼Œåˆä¸æ­»ä¹‹åä¹Ÿã€‚ ç§¦çš‡å¸ä¸å¾—ä¸Šå°ï¼Œé™›ä¸‹å¿…æ¬²ä¸Šï¼Œç¨ä¸Šå³ç„¡é¢¨é›¨ï¼Œé‚ä¸Šå°çŸ£ã€‚ã€ ä¸Šæ–¼æ˜¯ä¹ƒä»¤è«¸å„’ç¿’å°„ç‰›ï¼Œè‰å°ç¦ªå„€ã€‚ æ•¸å¹´ï¼Œè‡³ä¸”è¡Œã€‚ å¤©å­æ—¢èå…¬å­«å¿åŠæ–¹å£«ä¹‹è¨€ï¼Œé»ƒå¸ä»¥ä¸Šå°ç¦ªï¼Œçš†è‡´æ€ªç‰©èˆ‡ç¥é€šï¼Œæ¬²æ”¾é»ƒå¸ä»¥ä¸Šæ¥ç¥åƒŠäººè“¬èŠå£«ï¼Œé«˜ä¸–æ¯”å¾·æ–¼ä¹çš‡ï¼Œè€Œé —é‡‡å„’è¡“ä»¥æ–‡ä¹‹ã€‚ ç¾¤å„’æ—¢å·²ä¸èƒ½è¾¨æ˜å°ç¦ªäº‹ï¼Œåˆç‰½æ‹˜æ–¼è©©æ›¸å¤æ–‡è€Œä¸èƒ½é¨ã€‚ ä¸Šç‚ºå°ç¦ªç¥ å™¨ç¤ºç¾¤å„’ï¼Œç¾¤å„’æˆ–æ›°ã€Œä¸èˆ‡å¤åŒã€ï¼Œå¾åƒåˆæ›°ã€Œå¤ªå¸¸è«¸ç”Ÿè¡Œç¦®ä¸å¦‚é­¯å–„ã€ï¼Œå‘¨éœ¸å±¬åœ–å°ç¦ªäº‹ï¼Œæ–¼æ˜¯ä¸Šçµ€åƒã€éœ¸ï¼Œè€Œç›¡ç½·è«¸å„’ä¸ç”¨ã€‚
Since obtaining the treasure ding, the emperor with the dukes, ministers, and various scholars discussed feng and shan. Feng and shan used rare and distant cut off practices; none knew their ceremony and rites, and the group of ru collected feng and shan matters from the Shang Shu, Zhou Guan, Wang Zhi of wang sacrifices and shooting cows. The Qi person Ding Gong, aged over ninety, said: 'Feng and shan unites the name of immortality.' The Qin emperor did not obtain ascending feng; Your Majesty must want to ascend; gradually ascend and there will be no wind or rain, then ascend feng.' The emperor therefore then ordered the various ru to practice shooting cows and draft the feng and shan ceremonies. Several years later, it arrived and was about to go. The Son of Heaven having heard Gongsun Qing and the fangshi's words, that from the Yellow Emperor above, feng and shan all caused monsters and communication with gods; he wished to imitate the Yellow Emperor above and connect with god immortals and Penglai scholars, to stand high in the world and compare virtue to the Nine Sovereigns, and considerably collected ru methods to civilize it. The group of ru already could not distinguish and clarify feng and shan matters, and were also dragged and restrained by the poems, books, and ancient texts and could not gallop. The emperor showed the feng and shan sacrifice vessels to the group of ru; some of the group ru said 'not the same as ancient times'; Xu Yan again said 'The Grand Ceremonies' various scholars perform rites not as good as Lu'; Zhou Ba prepared maps of feng and shan matters; therefore the emperor demoted Yan and Ba, and completely dismissed the various ru without using them.

ä¸‰æœˆï¼Œé‚æ±å¹¸ç·±æ°ï¼Œç¦®ç™»ä¸­å¶½å¤ªå®¤ã€‚ å¾å®˜åœ¨å±±ä¸‹èè‹¥æœ‰è¨€ã€Œè¬æ­²ã€äº‘ã€‚ å•ä¸Šï¼Œä¸Šä¸è¨€ï¼› å•ä¸‹ï¼Œä¸‹ä¸è¨€ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯ä»¥ä¸‰ç™¾æˆ¶å°å¤ªå®¤å¥‰ç¥ ï¼Œå‘½æ›°å´‡é«˜é‚‘ã€‚ æ±ä¸Šæ³°å±±ï¼Œæ³°å±±ä¹‹è‰æœ¨è‘‰æœªç”Ÿï¼Œä¹ƒä»¤äººä¸ŠçŸ³ç«‹ä¹‹æ³°å±±å·”ã€‚
In the third month, he then went east to visit Gou Shi and ritually ascended the central peak Tai Shi. The following officials at the mountain below heard as if there were words 'ten thousand years,' they say. Asked the upper ones, the upper ones did not speak; Asked the lower ones, the lower ones did not speak. The emperor then toured east on the sea, performed rites and sacrificed to the eight gods. Qi people's memorials speaking of god strange and wondrous methods numbered in the tens of thousands, yet none were verified. Then he moreover sent ships and ordered those who spoke of god mountains in the seaâ€”several thousand peopleâ€”to seek Penglai god people. Gongsun Qing held the tally and constantly went first to await the famous mountains; arrived at Dong Lai and said at night he saw a great person several zhang in length; approaching it then it was not seen; saw its traces very big, like birds and beasts, they say. The group ministers had someone who spoke of seeing an old father leading a dog who said 'I wish to see the giant duke'; then suddenly he was not seen. The emperor immediately saw the big traces and did not yet believe; when the group ministers had spoken of the old father, then he greatly considered him an immortal person. In the fourth month, he returned to Feng Gao. The emperor thought that the various ru and fangshi spoke of feng and shan differently for each person; it was not regular and difficult to implement. The Son of Heaven arrived at Liang Fu and ritually sacrificed to the earth lord. On Yi Mao, he ordered the attendants who were ru ones to wear leather caps and recommend sashes, shoot cows and perform the affairs. He performed feng below Tai Shan in the east, like the suburban sacrifice rites to Tai Yi. The feng was broad two zhang and two chi, high nine chi; below it then had jade slips book, the book secret. Rites finished, the Son of Heaven alone with the attendants who presented the chariot Zi Hou ascended Tai Shan, also had feng. Its affairs were all forbidden. The next day, he descended by the shady path. On Bing Chen, he performed shan below Tai Shan at the altar northeast at Su Ran Shan, like the rites for sacrificing to Hou Tu. The Son of Heaven all personally bowed and saw, wore yellow above and completely used music there. Between Jiang and Huai, one thatch with three ridges was for the god's mat. Five-color earth moreover mixed in the feng. He released strange beasts and flying birds from distant places and white pheasants and various things, considerably with added rites. Pi cow, rhinoceros, elephant and such were not used. All arrived at Tai Shan to sacrifice to Hou Tu. Feng and shan sacrifice; Its night if had light, by day had white clouds rising in the feng middle.

The Son of Heaven returned from the shan, sat in the bright hall, the group ministers moreover offered longevity. Therefore he formulated an edict to the imperial secretaries: 'I with my tiny body receive the utmost honor; cautiously I fear I am not capable.' Only my virtue is meager and thin; I am not clear about rites and music.' I repaired and sacrificed to Tai Yi; if there were image shadow lights, bits like there was hope, shocked by monsters, wished to stop but did not dare, then ascended to feng Tai Shan, arrived at Liang Fu, and afterward performed shan at Su Ran. Renew myself; auspiciously with scholars and officials renew the beginning; grant to the people: hundred households one cow ten shi of wine; add for those aged eighty: orphans and widows two pi of cloth and silk. Exempt Bo, Feng Gao, She Qiu, Li Cheng; they need not pay this year's rent and taxes. There shall be a great amnesty for the world, like the Yi Mao amnesty order.' Places passed on the journey shall have no repeated labor.' Affairs from two years before shall all not be listened to and governed.' Again he issued an edict saying: 'Anciently the Son of Heaven toured and hunted once every five years, performed affairs at Tai Shan; feudal lords had morning lodging places.' Order the feudal lords each to repair residences below Tai Shan.'

The emperor believed it; Yue sacrifices and chicken divination began to be used.

å…¬å­«å¿æ›°ï¼šã€ŒåƒŠäººå¯è¦‹ï¼Œè€Œä¸Šå¾€å¸¸é½ï¼Œä»¥æ•…ä¸è¦‹ã€‚ ä»Šé™›ä¸‹å¯ç‚ºè§€ï¼Œå¦‚ç·±åŸï¼Œç½®è„¯æ£—ï¼Œç¥äººå®œå¯è‡´ä¹Ÿã€‚ ä¸”åƒŠäººå¥½æ¨“å±…ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ä¸Šä»¤é•·å®‰å‰‡ä½œèœšå»‰æ¡‚è§€ï¼Œç”˜æ³‰å‰‡ä½œç›Šå»¶å£½è§€ï¼Œä½¿å¿æŒç¯€è¨­å…·è€Œå€™ç¥äººã€‚ ä¹ƒä½œé€šå¤©è–è‡ºï¼Œç½®ç¥ å…·å…¶ä¸‹ï¼Œå°‡æ‹›ä¾†åƒŠç¥äººä¹‹å±¬ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯ç”˜æ³‰æ›´ç½®å‰æ®¿ï¼Œå§‹å»£è«¸å®®å®¤ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œæœ‰èŠç”Ÿæ®¿æˆ¿å…§ä¸­ã€‚ å¤©å­ç‚ºå¡æ²³ï¼Œèˆˆé€šå¤©è‡ºï¼Œè‹¥è¦‹æœ‰å…‰äº‘ï¼Œä¹ƒä¸‹è©”ï¼šã€Œç”˜æ³‰æˆ¿ä¸­ç”ŸèŠä¹è–ï¼Œèµ¦å¤©ä¸‹ï¼Œæ¯‹æœ‰å¾©ä½œã€‚ã€
Gongsun Qing said: 'Immortals can be seen, but the emperor went always hastily, for this reason they are not seen.' Now Your Majesty can make towers, like Gou city, place dried meat and dates; god people should be obtainable.' Moreover immortals like to dwell in towers.' Therefore the emperor ordered Chang'an to make Fei Lian Gui towers, Gan Quan to make Yi Yan Shou towers, sent Qing holding the tally to set up utensils and await god people. Then he made the Tong Tian Jing terrace, placed sacrifice utensils below it, will summon and bring immortal god people and their kind. Therefore at Gan Quan they again set the front hall, began enlarging the various palaces and rooms. In summer, there was ganoderma born in the hall room's inner middle. The Son of Heaven for blocking the Yellow River raised the Tong Tian terrace; if they saw there was light, they say, then he issued an edict: 'Gan Quan room middle born ganoderma nine stems; amnesty the world; none shall have repeated labor.'
91
å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œä¼æœé®®ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œæ—±ã€‚ å…¬å­«å¿æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚å°å‰‡å¤©æ—±ï¼Œä¹¾å°ä¸‰å¹´ã€‚ã€ ä¸Šä¹ƒä¸‹è©”æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤©æ—±ï¼Œæ„ä¹¾å°ä¹ï¼Ÿ å…¶ä»¤å¤©ä¸‹å°Šç¥ éˆæ˜Ÿç„‰ã€‚ã€
Its next year, he attacked Chaoxian. In summer, there was drought. Gongsun Qing said: 'In the Yellow Emperor's time when he performed feng then heaven had drought; dry feng three years.' The emperor then issued an edict saying: 'There is heaven drought; does it mean dry feng?' Order the world to honor and sacrifice to the spirit star there.'
92
å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œä¸ŠéƒŠé›ï¼Œé€šå›ä¸­é“ï¼Œå·¡ä¹‹ã€‚ æ˜¥ï¼Œè‡³é³´æ¾¤ï¼Œå¾è¥¿æ²³æ­¸ã€‚
Its next year, the emperor performed suburban sacrifices at Yong, opened the Hui Zhong road, toured it. In spring, he arrived at Ming Ze, returned from Xi He.

å…¶æ˜å¹´å†¬ï¼Œä¸Šå·¡å—éƒ¡ï¼Œè‡³æ±Ÿé™µè€Œæ±ã€‚ ç™»ç¦®çŠä¹‹å¤©æŸ±å±±ï¼Œè™Ÿæ›°å—å²³ã€‚ æµ®æ±Ÿï¼Œè‡ªå°‹é™½å‡ºæ¨…é™½ï¼Œéå½­è ¡ï¼Œç¦®å…¶åå±±å·ã€‚ åŒ—è‡³ç‘¯é‚ªï¼Œå¹¶æµ·ä¸Šã€‚ å››æœˆä¸­ï¼Œè‡³å¥‰é«˜ä¿®å°ç„‰ã€‚
Its next year winter, the emperor toured Nan Jun, arrived at Jiang Ling and went east. He ascended and ritually observed Qian's Tian Zhu Shan, named it South Yue. He floated on the Jiang, from Xun Yang out to Cong Yang, passed Peng Li, ritually observed its famous mountains and rivers. He went north to Lang Ya, along the sea above. In the middle of the fourth month, he arrived at Feng Gao and repaired the feng there.
94
åˆï¼Œå¤©å­å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œæ³°å±±æ±åŒ—é˜¯å¤æ™‚æœ‰æ˜å ‚è™•ï¼Œè™•éšªä¸æ•ã€‚ ä¸Šæ¬²æ²»æ˜å ‚å¥‰é«˜æ—ï¼Œæœªæ›‰å…¶åˆ¶åº¦ã€‚ æ¿Ÿå—äººå…¬çŠå¸¶ä¸Šé»ƒå¸æ™‚æ˜å ‚åœ–ã€‚ æ˜å ‚åœ–ä¸­æœ‰ä¸€æ®¿ï¼Œå››é¢ç„¡å£ï¼Œä»¥èŒ…è“‹ï¼Œé€šæ°´ï¼Œåœœå®®å£ç‚ºè¤‡é“ï¼Œä¸Šæœ‰æ¨“ï¼Œå¾è¥¿å—å…¥ï¼Œå‘½æ›°æ˜†ä¾–ï¼Œå¤©å­å¾ä¹‹å…¥ï¼Œä»¥æ‹œç¥ ä¸Šå¸ç„‰ã€‚ æ–¼æ˜¯ä¸Šä»¤å¥‰é«˜ä½œæ˜å ‚æ±¶ä¸Šï¼Œå¦‚å¸¶åœ–ã€‚ åŠäº”å¹´ä¿®å°ï¼Œå‰‡ç¥ å¤ªä¸€ã€äº”å¸æ–¼æ˜å ‚ä¸Šåï¼Œä»¤é«˜çš‡å¸ç¥ åå°ä¹‹ã€‚ ç¥ ååœŸæ–¼ä¸‹æˆ¿ï¼Œä»¥äºŒåå¤ªç‰¢ã€‚ å¤©å­å¾æ˜†ä¾–é“å…¥ï¼Œå§‹æ‹œæ˜å ‚å¦‚éƒŠç¦®ã€‚ ç¦®ç•¢ï¼Œç‡å ‚ä¸‹ã€‚ è€Œä¸Šåˆä¸Šæ³°å±±ï¼Œè‡ªæœ‰ç¥•ç¥ å…¶å·”ã€‚ è€Œæ³°å±±ä¸‹ç¥ äº”å¸ï¼Œå„å¦‚å…¶æ–¹ï¼Œé»ƒå¸å¹¶èµ¤å¸ï¼Œè€Œæœ‰å¸ä¾ç¥ ç„‰ã€‚ å±±ä¸Šèˆ‰ç«ï¼Œä¸‹æ‚‰æ‡‰ä¹‹ã€‚
Initially, when the Son of Heaven performed feng at Tai Shan, Tai Shan's northeast altar in ancient times had a bright hall place; the place was dangerous and not spacious. The emperor wished to govern the bright hall beside Feng Gao, not yet clear on its system and regulations. The Ji Nan person Gong Yu Dai presented a diagram of the bright hall from the Yellow Emperor's time. In the bright hall diagram there was one hall, four sides without walls, covered with thatch, through water, round palace walls as double roads, above had a tower, entered from the southwest, named Kun Lun; the Son of Heaven entered from it to bow and sacrifice to Shang Di there. Therefore the emperor ordered Feng Gao to make the bright hall above Wen, like Dai's diagram. And when five years repaired the feng, then sacrificed to Tai Yi and the Five Emperors at the bright hall's upper seat, ordered the Gao Emperor's sacrifice seat to face it. Sacrificed to Hou Tu in the lower room, with twenty great pens. The Son of Heaven entered from the Kun Lun road, first bowed to the bright hall like suburban rites. Rites finished, burned below the hall. And the emperor again ascended Tai Shan, himself had a secret sacrifice at its summit. And below Tai Shan sacrificed to the Five Emperors, each according to their direction; the Yellow Emperor together with the Red Emperor, and officials served the sacrifice there. Above the mountain raised fire, below all responded to it.
95
å…¶å¾ŒäºŒæ­²ï¼Œåä¸€æœˆç”²å­æœ”æ—¦å†¬è‡³ï¼Œæ¨æ­·è€…ä»¥æœ¬çµ±ã€‚ å¤©å­è¦ªè‡³æ³°å±±ï¼Œä»¥åä¸€æœˆç”²å­æœ”æ—¦å†¬è‡³æ—¥ç¥ ä¸Šå¸æ˜å ‚ï¼Œæ¯‹ä¿®å°ç¦ªã€‚ å…¶è´Šé¥—æ›°ï¼šã€Œå¤©å¢æˆçš‡å¸å¤ªå…ƒç¥ç­–ï¼Œå‘¨è€Œå¾©å§‹ã€‚ çš‡å¸æ•¬æ‹œå¤ªä¸€ã€‚ã€ æ±è‡³æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œè€ƒå…¥æµ·åŠæ–¹å£«æ±‚ç¥è€…ï¼Œè«é©—ï¼Œç„¶ç›Šé£ï¼Œå†€é‡ä¹‹ã€‚
Two years after, eleventh month Jia Zi first day and winter solstice; those who pushed the calendar used the fundamental system. The Son of Heaven personally arrived at Tai Shan, on the eleventh month Jia Zi first day and winter solstice day sacrificed to Shang Di at the bright hall, did not repair feng and shan. Its zan xiang said: 'Heaven increased and gave the emperor great beginning divine plan, cycle and begin again.' The emperor respectfully bowed to Tai Yi.' East arrived above the sea, examined those who entered the sea and fangshi who sought gods; none were verified, yet moreover sent, hoped to meet them.

åä¸€æœˆä¹™é…‰ï¼ŒæŸæ¢ç½ã€‚ åäºŒæœˆç”²åˆæœ”ï¼Œä¸Šè¦ªç¦ªé«˜é‡Œï¼Œç¥ ååœŸã€‚ è‡¨å‹ƒæµ·ï¼Œå°‡ä»¥æœ›ç¥€è“¬èŠä¹‹å±¬ï¼Œå†€è‡³æ®Šå»·ç„‰ã€‚
Eleventh month Yi You, Bo Liang had a disaster. Twelfth month Jia Wu first day, the emperor personally performed shan at Gao Li, sacrificed to Hou Tu. Faced Bo Hai, about to gaze and sacrifice to Penglai and its kind, hoped to arrive at the special court there.

ä¸Šé‚„ï¼Œä»¥æŸæ¢ç½æ•…ï¼Œæœå—è¨ˆç”˜æ³‰ã€‚ å…¬å­«å¿æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸å°±é’éˆè‡ºï¼ŒåäºŒæ—¥ç‡’ï¼Œé»ƒå¸ä¹ƒæ²»æ˜å»·ã€‚ æ˜å»·ï¼Œç”˜æ³‰ä¹Ÿã€‚ã€ æ–¹å£«å¤šè¨€å¤å¸ç‹æœ‰éƒ½ç”˜æ³‰è€…ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œå¤©å­åˆæœè«¸ä¾¯ç”˜æ³‰ï¼Œç”˜æ³‰ä½œè«¸ä¾¯é‚¸ã€‚ å‹‡ä¹‹ä¹ƒæ›°ï¼šã€Œè¶Šä¿—æœ‰ç«ç½ï¼Œå¾©èµ·å±‹å¿…ä»¥å¤§ï¼Œç”¨å‹æœä¹‹ã€‚ã€ æ–¼æ˜¯ä½œå»ºç« å®®ï¼Œåº¦ç‚ºåƒé–€è¬æˆ¶ã€‚ å‰æ®¿åº¦é«˜æœªå¤®ã€‚ å…¶æ±å‰‡é³³é—•ï¼Œé«˜äºŒåé¤˜ä¸ˆã€‚ å…¶è¥¿å‰‡å”ä¸­ï¼Œæ•¸åé‡Œè™åœˆã€‚ å…¶åŒ—æ²»å¤§æ± ï¼Œæ¼¸è‡ºé«˜äºŒåé¤˜ä¸ˆï¼Œå‘½æ›°å¤ªæ¶²æ± ï¼Œä¸­æœ‰è“¬èŠã€æ–¹ä¸ˆã€ç€›æ´²ã€å£ºæ¢ï¼Œè±¡æµ·ä¸­ç¥å±±é¾œé­šä¹‹å±¬ã€‚ å…¶å—æœ‰ç‰å ‚ã€ç’§é–€ã€å¤§é³¥ä¹‹å±¬ã€‚ ä¹ƒç«‹ç¥æ˜è‡ºã€äº•å¹¹æ¨“ï¼Œåº¦äº”åä¸ˆï¼Œè¼¦é“ç›¸å±¬ç„‰ã€‚
The emperor returned; because of the Bo Liang disaster, in the morning received accounts at Gan Quan. Gongsun Qing said: 'The Yellow Emperor approached the Qing Ling terrace; twelve days it burned; the Yellow Emperor then governed the bright court.' The bright court is Gan Quan.' Fangshi many said that ancient emperor kings had capitals at Gan Quan. Afterward the Son of Heaven again held morning audiences for feudal lords at Gan Quan; Gan Quan made feudal lords' residences. Admired it and then said: 'Yue custom has fire disasters; rebuild houses must be with big ones; use to overcome and subdue it.' Therefore made the Jian Zhang palace, measured as a thousand gates and ten thousand rooms. The front hall measured as high as Wei Yang. To its east then Feng Que, high twenty or more zhang. To its west then Tang Zhong, several dozen li of tiger enclosures. To its north governed a big pond; Jian terrace high twenty or more zhang; named Tai Ye pond; in the middle had Penglai, Fang Zhang, Ying Zhou, Hu Liang; symbolized sea middle god mountains, turtle, fish and their kind. To its south had jade hall, bi gate, big bird and their kind. Then established Shen Ming terrace, Jing Gan tower; measured fifty zhang; sedan roads connected there.

å¤ï¼Œæ¼¢æ”¹æ­·ï¼Œä»¥æ­£æœˆç‚ºæ­²é¦–ï¼Œè€Œè‰²ä¸Šé»ƒï¼Œå®˜åæ›´å°ç« ä»¥äº”å­—ï¼Œç‚ºå¤ªåˆå…ƒå¹´ã€‚ æ˜¯æ­²ï¼Œè¥¿ä¼å¤§å®›ã€‚ è—å¤§èµ·ã€‚ ä¸å¤«äººã€é›’é™½è™åˆç­‰ä»¥æ–¹ç¥ è©›åŒˆå¥´ã€å¤§å®›ç„‰ã€‚
In summer, Han changed the calendar, taking the first month as the year's beginning; and honored yellow in color; official names changed seals and stamps with five characters; this was Tai Chu first year. This year, attacked Da Yuan in the west. Locusts greatly arose. Ding lady, Luo Yang Yu Chu and others with methods sacrificed and cursed the Xiongnu and Da Yuan there.

å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œæœ‰å¸ä¸Šè¨€é›äº”ç•¤ç„¡ç‰¢ç†Ÿå…·ï¼ŒèŠ¬èŠ³ä¸å‚™ã€‚ ä¹ƒä»¤ç¥ å®˜é€²ç•¤çŠ¢ç‰¢å…·ï¼Œè‰²é£Ÿæ‰€å‹ï¼Œè€Œä»¥æœ¨ç¦ºé¦¬ä»£é§’ç„‰ã€‚ ç¨äº”æœˆå˜—é§’ï¼Œè¡Œè¦ªéƒŠç”¨é§’ã€‚ åŠè«¸åå±±å·ç”¨é§’è€…ï¼Œæ‚‰ä»¥æœ¨ç¦ºé¦¬ä»£ã€‚ è¡Œéï¼Œä¹ƒç”¨é§’ã€‚ ä»–ç¦®å¦‚æ•…ã€‚
Its next year, officials memorialed that Yong's five zhi had no pen or cooked utensils; the fragrances were not complete. Then ordered sacrifice officials to advance zhi calf pen utensils; color food what overcomes; and replace colts with wood yu horses there. Alone in the fifth month tasted the colt; performed personal suburban rites using the colt. And for the various famous mountains and rivers that used colts, all replaced with wood yu horses. When the journey passed, then used the colt. Other rites were as before.

å…¶æ˜å¹´ï¼Œæ±å·¡æµ·ä¸Šï¼Œè€ƒç¥åƒŠä¹‹å±¬ï¼Œæœªæœ‰é©—è€…ã€‚ æ–¹å£«æœ‰è¨€ã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚ç‚ºäº”åŸåäºŒæ¨“ï¼Œä»¥å€™ç¥äººæ–¼åŸ·æœŸï¼Œå‘½æ›°è¿å¹´ã€ã€‚ ä¸Šè¨±ä½œä¹‹å¦‚æ–¹ï¼Œå‘½æ›°æ˜å¹´ã€‚ ä¸Šè¦ªç¦®ç¥ ä¸Šå¸ç„‰ã€‚
Its next year, toured east on the sea above, examined god immortals and their kind; not yet had verified ones. Fangshi had said 'In the Yellow Emperor's time made five cities and twelve towers, to await god people at Zhi Qi; named Ying Nian.' The emperor permitted making it like the method, named Ming Nian. The emperor personally performed rites and sacrificed to Shang Di there.
101
å…¬çŠå¸¶æ›°ï¼šã€Œé»ƒå¸æ™‚é›–å°æ³°å±±ï¼Œç„¶é¢¨åã€å°å·¨ã€å²ä¼¯ä»¤é»ƒå¸å°æ±æ³°å±±ï¼Œç¦ªå‡¡å±±ï¼Œåˆç¬¦ï¼Œç„¶å¾Œä¸æ­»ç„‰ã€‚ã€ å¤©å­æ—¢ä»¤è¨­ç¥ å…·ï¼Œè‡³æ±æ³°å±±ï¼Œï¼»æ±ï¼½æ³°å±±å‘å°ï¼Œä¸ç¨±å…¶è²ï¼Œä¹ƒä»¤ç¥ å®˜ç¦®ä¹‹ï¼Œè€Œä¸å°ç¦ªç„‰ã€‚ å…¶å¾Œä»¤å¸¶å¥‰ç¥ å€™ç¥ç‰©ã€‚ å¤ï¼Œé‚é‚„æ³°å±±ï¼Œä¿®äº”å¹´ä¹‹ç¦®å¦‚å‰ï¼Œè€ŒåŠ ä»¥ç¦ªç¥ çŸ³é–­ã€‚ çŸ³é–­è€…ï¼Œåœ¨æ³°å±±ä¸‹é˜¯å—æ–¹ï¼Œæ–¹å£«å¤šè¨€æ­¤åƒŠäººä¹‹é–­ä¹Ÿï¼Œæ•…ä¸Šè¦ªç¦ªç„‰ã€‚
Gong Yu Dai said: 'In the Yellow Emperor's time although performed feng at Tai Shan, yet Feng Hou, Feng Ju, Qi Bo made the Yellow Emperor feng at east Tai Shan, shan at Fan Shan, unite the talisman, then not die there.' The Son of Heaven having ordered sacrifice utensils set, arrived at east Tai Shan; east Tai Shan was low and small, not matching its reputation; then ordered sacrifice officials to ritual it, and did not feng shan there. Afterward ordered Dai to present sacrifice and await god things. In summer, then returned to Tai Shan, repaired the five years rites as before, and added shan sacrifice at Shi Lu. Shi Lu is at Tai Shan below the altar south; fangshi many said this is the immortal person's gate; therefore the emperor personally performed shan there.

å…¶å¾Œäº”å¹´ï¼Œå¾©è‡³æ³°å±±ä¿®å°ã€‚ é‚„éç¥­æ’å±±ã€‚
Five years after, again arrived at Tai Shan and repaired the feng. On return passed by and sacrificed at Heng Shan.

ä»Šå¤©å­æ‰€èˆˆç¥ ï¼Œå¤ªä¸€ã€ååœŸï¼Œä¸‰å¹´è¦ªéƒŠç¥ ï¼Œå»ºæ¼¢å®¶å°ç¦ªï¼Œäº”å¹´ä¸€ä¿®å°ã€‚ è–„å¿Œå¤ªä¸€åŠä¸‰ä¸€ã€å†¥ç¾Šã€é¦¬è¡Œã€èµ¤æ˜Ÿï¼Œäº”ï¼Œå¯¬èˆ’ä¹‹ç¥ å®˜ä»¥æ­²æ™‚è‡´ç¦®ã€‚ å‡¡å…­ç¥ ï¼Œçš†å¤ªç¥é ˜ä¹‹ã€‚ è‡³å¦‚å…«ç¥è«¸ç¥ï¼Œæ˜å¹´ã€å‡¡å±±ä»–åç¥ ï¼Œè¡Œéå‰‡ç¥ ï¼Œè¡Œå»å‰‡å·²ã€‚ æ–¹å£«æ‰€èˆˆç¥ ï¼Œå„è‡ªä¸»ï¼Œå…¶äººçµ‚å‰‡å·²ï¼Œç¥ å®˜ä¸ä¸»ã€‚ ä»–ç¥ çš†å¦‚å…¶æ•…ã€‚ ä»Šä¸Šå°ç¦ªï¼Œå…¶å¾ŒåäºŒæ­²è€Œé‚„ï¼Œéæ–¼äº”å²³ã€å››ç€†çŸ£ã€‚ è€Œæ–¹å£«ä¹‹å€™ç¥ ç¥äººï¼Œå…¥æµ·æ±‚è“¬èŠï¼Œçµ‚ç„¡æœ‰é©—ã€‚ è€Œå…¬å­«å¿ä¹‹å€™ç¥è€…ï¼ŒçŒ¶ä»¥å¤§äººä¹‹è·¡ç‚ºè§£ï¼Œç„¡æœ‰æ•ˆã€‚ å¤©å­ç›Šæ€ å­æ–¹å£«ä¹‹æ€ªè¿‚èªçŸ£ï¼Œç„¶ç¾ˆç¸»ä¸çµ•ï¼Œå†€é‡å…¶çœŸã€‚ è‡ªæ­¤ä¹‹å¾Œï¼Œæ–¹å£«è¨€ç¥ç¥ è€…å½Œçœ¾ï¼Œç„¶å…¶æ•ˆå¯ç¹çŸ£ã€‚ å¤ªå²å…¬æ›°ï¼šä½™å¾å·¡ç¥­å¤©åœ°è«¸ç¥åå±±å·è€Œå°ç¦ªç„‰ã€‚ å…¥å£½å®®ä¾ç¥ ç¥èªï¼Œç©¶è§€æ–¹å£«ç¥ å®˜ä¹‹æ„ï¼Œæ–¼æ˜¯é€€è€Œè«–æ¬¡è‡ªå¤ä»¥ä¾†ç”¨äº‹æ–¼é¬¼ç¥è€…ï¼Œå…·è¦‹å…¶è¡¨è£ã€‚ å¾Œæœ‰å›å­ï¼Œå¾—ä»¥è¦½ç„‰ã€‚ è‹¥è‡³ä¿è±†çªå¹£ä¹‹è©³ï¼Œç»é…¬ä¹‹ç¦®ï¼Œå‰‡æœ‰å¸å­˜ã€‚
Now the Son of Heaven established sacrifices: Tai Yi, Hou Tu; three years personally suburban sacrificed; established Han family feng shan; five years one repaired feng. Bo Ji Tai Yi and San Yi, Ming Yang, Ma Xing, Chi Xingâ€”five; Kuan Shu's sacrifice officials performed rites according to the seasons. Altogether six sacrifices; all were led by the Grand Officiant. As for the eight gods and various gods, Ming Nian, Fan Shan and other named sacrifices; journey passed then sacrificed, journey gone then stopped. Fangshi established sacrifices; each self mastered; their person ended then stopped; sacrifice officials not mastered. Other sacrifices all as their former. Now the emperor performed feng shan; twelve years after and returned; covered the five peaks and four estuaries. And the fangshi who awaited and sacrificed to god people, entered the sea and sought Penglai; in the end none had verification. And Gongsun Qing's ones who awaited gods still used great person traces as explanation; no effect. The Son of Heaven increasingly grew weary and disliked the fangshi's strange and circuitous words; yet restrained them without cutting off, hoped to meet their true. From this after, fangshi who spoke of god sacrifices increasingly many; yet their effect could be seen. The Grand Historian said: I followed and toured sacrificing to heaven, earth, various gods, famous mountains and rivers and performed feng shan there. Entered Shou Gong and served sacrifice god words; thoroughly observed fangshi and sacrifice officials' intentions; therefore retreated and arranged in order from ancient times those who used affairs with ghosts and gods; fully saw their outer and inner. Later noble ones can view it. If to the zu dou gui bi details, xian chou rites, then the officials store them.
